dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong
News Content: Heading into 2023, Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway's (NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) had a substantial investment in General Motors(NYSE: GM). According to Berkshire's SEC filings, the conglomerate owned 50 million shares of GM at the beginning of that year, worth about $1.7 billion at the time.

Throughout 2023, Buffett unloaded all of Berkshire's General Motors stock. However, I think he made the wrong decision. Not only is General Motors up by more than 55% since the end of the quarter when Berkshire sold, but the company is also doing a great job of maximizing profits and creating shareholder value.

Lots to like about this "legacy" automaker

Even though Buffett sold GM, there's quite a bit to like about the stock right now.

For one thing, the business has been surprisingly resilient, given the combination of higher interest rates and more cautious consumer spending. In the company's third-quarter 2024 earnings, the latest reported, GM surprised investors with both top- and bottom-line results that handily surpassed expectations, as well as an increase in its full-year earnings guidance.

Then, at its October 2024 investor day, management surprised the market, which expected a slowdown, by saying that its 2025 adjusted earnings will be in a "similar range" to 2024.

Other recent news has been quite encouraging as well. GM reported that its 2024 sales increased by 4% and that its market share increased overall and doubled in the case of electric vehicles. Deliveries in China increased by 40.6% sequentially in the fourth quarter.

Another recent development is that GM will pivot its Cruise autonomous strategy away from developing robotaxis and toward developing its Super Cruise autonomous technology for personal vehicles. This move alone is expected to save the company more than $1 billion annually.

GM is also aggressively using excess capital to buy back shares. Since late 2023, when GM announced an accelerated buyback program, the company's outstanding share count has declined by 21%, and there could be more buybacks ahead, especially considering the stronger-than-expected 2025 outlook and the fact that it hopefully won't be sinking as much money into automation. It's also worth noting that since the buyback was announced, GM's stock is up by more than 40%.

It's not too surprising that GM is being so aggressive with buybacks. The stock trades for just 5.5 times trailing-12-month earnings and 5.1 times forward earnings. If GM can achieve its 2025 targets and execute well on its growth plans, the stock could be a tremendous bargain.

Story Continues

Why did Buffett sell?

Buffett hasn't specified his reasons for selling General Motors. But it's worth noting that he has been a net seller of stocks for the past couple of years and has aggressively reduced some of Berkshire's largest investments, including the massive stakes in Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) and Bank of America(NYSE: BAC).

My instinct is that he sold because of some of the perceived risk factors with the stock. At the time of the sales, many experts were forecasting new auto demand to fall more than it actually did, and in the fall of 2023, there was a strike by auto workers that cost GM an estimated $800 million.

Whatever the reasons Buffett had for selling might be, I think he's wrong, and I don't often say that about Buffett's moves. GM is doing a fantastic job of keeping its sales and profit high, and I think this could be one of the biggest bargains in the stock market right now.

Should you invest $1,000 in General Motors right now?

Before you buy stock in General Motors, consider this:

The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks for investors to buy now… and General Motors wasn’t one of them. The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years.

Consider when Nvidia made this list on April 15, 2005... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you’d have $843,960!*

Stock Advisor provides investors with an easy-to-follow blueprint for success, including guidance on building a portfolio, regular updates from analysts, and two new stock picks each month. TheStock Advisorservice has more than quadrupled the return of S&P 500 since 2002*.

See the 10 stocks »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 13, 2025

Bank of America is an advertising partner of Motley Fool Money. Matt Frankel has positions in Bank of America, Berkshire Hathaway, and General Motors. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple, Bank of America, and Berkshire Hathaway. The Motley Fool recommends General Motors and recommends the following options: long January 2025 $25 calls on General Motors. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The recent downgrades by analysts due to soft iPhone sales and concerns about consumer demand, especially in China, have weakened market sentiment around Apple Inc. The drop of 3.2% on Tuesday and the overall trend of a significant decline (11% in January) suggest that there is a negative outlook among investors. Given that two prominent analysts have expressed bearish sentiment and that the consensus buy rating has declined, it’s reasonable to predict a higher probability of further decline than an increase in stock price in the short term.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news is predominantly negative. Two downgrades from Jefferies and Loop Capital, citing weak iPhone sales (particularly in China), declining market share, and a lack of investor enthusiasm for Apple's AI initiatives, all point towards potential downward pressure on the stock price. The specific mentions of reduced revenue forecasts and the underperformance of Apple's stock compared to its Big Tech peers and the S&P 500 further solidify this bearish outlook. While a new iPhone SE and other product releases are mentioned as potential positive catalysts, they are presented as possibilities rather than certainties and are unlikely to immediately offset the current negative sentiment. The fact that the stock already fell 3.7% on the news emphasizes the market's concern. Earnings are slated to be released soon, which could provide additional insight into the actual performance of the company in the last quarter. However, the current projections, given the analyst downgrades, suggest disappointing results.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news focuses on Meta's expansion into wearable technology, directly competing with Apple's existing product lines (smartwatches and AirPods).  While Meta's advancements in AR/VR are noteworthy, the impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be indirect and relatively small. Meta's success in these new markets isn't guaranteed, and the news doesn't present any immediate threat to Apple's core business or financial performance.  The probability of a stock price rise or fall is therefore mostly dependent on other market factors and not significantly influenced by this specific news.  A slightly higher probability of no change is implied.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news highlights a 4.1% drop in Apple's stock price due to downgrades by two Wall Street analysts (Jefferies and Loop Capital), citing disappointing iPhone sales in the December quarter, particularly in China, and skepticism around the immediate impact of Apple Intelligence on consumer demand. The downgrades and lowered price targets reflect concerns over near-term performance and delayed AI benefits. Given the negative sentiment, weak guidance, and high valuation (36x earnings), the market is likely to react negatively in the short term. However, Loop Capital's optimism about long-term growth and AI potential provides some counterbalance, though not enough to outweigh the immediate concerns.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that Wall Street firms, such as Loop Capital and Jefferies, have downgraded Apple's stock due to slowing growth in China. The analyst, Ben Bajarin, mentions that while Apple dominates the premium price tier in China, there is uncertainty about future growth in the region. He also notes that the AI story is still in its early stages and that a hardware cycle is needed to excite investors again. This downgrade and cautious outlook are likely to negatively impact the stock price in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The article discusses how Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold its stake in General Motors, but the author believes this decision was wrong. The company has been performing well, with resilient business, strong earnings, and increasing market share, especially in electric vehicles. Additionally, the company is aggressively using excess capital to buy back shares, which has positively impacted the stock price. Given this information, it seems the news is actually about General Motors (GM) and not directly about Apple Inc. (AAPL), but since AAPL is mentioned as one of the stocks Buffett has been a net seller of, there might be a slight indirect implication. However, the main focus is on GM's positive outlook, not AAPL's. Therefore, the reasoning for AAPL's stock price movement is indirect and not strongly influenced by this news.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.9, Reasoning: The financial news highlights multiple downgrades and concerns around iPhone sales, particularly in China, and a lack of growth catalysts from AI. These factors are likely to continue exerting downward pressure on Apple's stock price. Multiple analysts have revised their ratings downward, indicating a bearish sentiment towards the stock. Moreover, Apple's guidance for the upcoming quarter is predicted to disappoint, and the stock's performance this month has already shown a significant decline, adding to the negative momentum.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The recent downgrades by Loop Capital and Jefferies due to significantly weakened iPhone sales, particularly in China, underscore a deteriorating outlook for Apple. The downgrades reflect lower expectations for future earnings and potential disappointing guidance for the upcoming quarter, leading to increased bearish sentiment. Furthermore, a majority of analysts still hold a buy rating, but the overall downward trend in stock price and market capitalization suggests that investor confidence has been shaken. Therefore, the probabilities indicate a high likelihood of further declines in the stock price in the near term, amid ongoing investor concerns.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The consensus from previous rounds heavily leans towards a negative outlook for Apple's stock. The news article details downgrades from two firms citing weak iPhone sales, particularly in China, and skepticism about the impact of Apple's AI initiatives. The company's struggles in China, compounded by competition and slower economic growth, are significant concerns. While a new iPhone SE and other product releases are mentioned as potential catalysts, they seem unlikely to offset immediate pressures. The previous predictions reflect this negative sentiment. Given the continued emphasis on these problems in this round's news, I expect the short-term pressure on the stock to continue outweighing any positive impacts from other developments.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news focuses on Meta's expansion into wearable technology, which is a competitive threat to Apple in the long term. However, the news is not directly about Apple and does not contain any immediate negative or positive information about Apple's financial performance or products.  The impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be indirect and minor.  Considering previous predictions largely focused on negative Apple-specific news (downgrades, weak sales), and this news is comparatively neutral, the probability of a stock price movement associated with this news is low. The influence of this news alone is likely to be overshadowed by other market factors and pre-existing sentiment around Apple.  Therefore, the probabilities lean towards a relatively unchanged stock price, with slightly higher odds of no movement than either a rise or fall.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.75, Reasoning: The news highlights significant negative factors affecting Apple Inc., including downgrades by two major analysts (Jefferies and Loop Capital), disappointing iPhone sales in the December quarter, particularly in China, and skepticism around the immediate impact of Apple Intelligence. These downgrades and the lowered price targets reflect concerns over near-term performance and delayed AI benefits. The high valuation (36x earnings) and weak guidance further exacerbate the negative sentiment. While Loop Capital maintains some optimism about long-term growth, the immediate concerns dominate the market outlook. Given the overwhelming negative sentiment and the stock's recent decline, the probability of a further fall is higher than a rise.

Analyst Ben Bajarin mentions that while Apple dominates the premium price tier in China, there is uncertainty about future growth in the region. He also notes that the AI story is still in its early stages and that a hardware cycle is needed to excite investors again. These downgrades and the cautious outlook are likely to negatively impact the stock price in the short term. Although the article mentions Apple Inc. as one of the stocks Buffett has been a net seller of, the main focus is on GM's positive outlook. Given the indirect implication and the lack of direct information about Apple's current performance or prospects, the probability of Apple's stock price movement is not strongly influenced by this news. The news itself doesn't provide any direct information about Apple's financial performance or immediate prospects.  The previous predictions heavily favor a negative outlook for Apple due to concerns about weak iPhone sales (especially in China), analyst downgrades, and skepticism about the short-term impact of Apple's AI initiatives.  This negative sentiment is significantly more influential than the relatively neutral news about Meta's product expansion. "reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]",

}
